website_summaries.verdict: For light- to medium-pressure DIY projects like repairing furniture or picture frames, this clamp is a perfect fit, balancing quality and price.
pros: Delivers good holding force without the worry of warping or breaking parts off
Tightens well with no play in the mechanism, allowing for a precise hold
cons: Release button can be awkward to use
Will bow out a bit when clamping heavier materials together

customer_reviews.title: Broke like a piece of chalk!
customer_reviews.text: Well, such a disappointment when you pay the premium with the hope of getting a better quality. There are a dozen other alternatives out there that are cheaper and don't fail like this.
customer_reviews.author: Shobeir

customer_reviews.title: Not a quality piece.
customer_reviews.text: I have many of the older made in Germany clamps without the quick release. I also have many of the harbor freight f style clamps. my preferred order is the german, then HF then one of my other clamps, then maybe this... maybe. The clamp I received did not have a flat top pad, the metal was physically formed at an angle causing the clamp to either sit at an angle or for the top pad to dig in harder on one side. over all it just feels cheap. yet it isn't as inexpensive as other cheap clamps.
customer_reviews.author: josh

customer_reviews.title: cheaper at Home depo.
customer_reviews.text: these work just fine, but I returned them and got a set of 4 from home depo for 14.00 bucks that set was 2, 6" and 2, 12" clamps. way better value than amazon currently. That set is also bessy, which all in all work fine for general wood working clamping needs.
customer_reviews.author: Robert F. Hettel

customer_reviews.title: Great Clamps!
customer_reviews.text: Picked up a smaller set of these from the Orange Box as a cheaper alternative to "quick grip" style clamps. After the first project, I was so impressed, I bought more. With the larger ones, I already know what to expect and they will be perfect for my novice projects. There may be other alternatives for craftsman that are better quality, but these will handle about 90% of the average DIYers needs.
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel

customer_reviews.title: DIY projects, go for it!
customer_reviews.text: I accidentally busted one of the little cabinet doors under my bathroom sink, the door ripped clean off, but the hinge-region remained intact. Instead of putting $100 into a new door, I got this clamp as well as some wood glue...I put the glue on, clamped it together, and voila! The door is almost good as new. This thing is awkwardly bulky (long), so storing it is kinda a trick, but it's well worth to have around.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: It's a no-frills clamp, but it's well-made, and for the price, you probably won't find anything better on Amazon. I had clamps from Stanley, Irwin, Tekton, and a bunch of other budget manufacturers - and many of them had serious flaws. In comparison, Bessey is just better: the clamps are well made, have no play, are easy to release and reposition, and the plastic caps don't come off constantly and can withstand some abuse. Their fancier clamps with larger clamping surfaces, such as UniKlamp and REVO, are pretty sweet, too.
customer_reviews.author: one bad catTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Hard to use  ...for me.
customer_reviews.text: The clamp is as advertised. However, that little lever clamp spring is too hard for me to operate easily. I'm 60. I have to fight with it. I like the simpler Bessey clamps (same style) that I bought it the past. I kept. I'll use it. It's just not the first clamp I reach for.
customer_reviews.author: HomeCoder

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and Effective
customer_reviews.text: There are some pretty bad reviews for these. I've been using them for about a year now and havent cracked or broken any of them. I've lost several of the rubber ends but I just stick a block of wood in there to protect the project. They flex if over tightened. They're not the best, but do the same thing. They're cheap and you can never have to many clamps.
customer_reviews.author: BobQCarter

customer_reviews.title: Good quality but annoying clicking sound
customer_reviews.text: This has a good build, but it's a bit tight to adjust, also there is this annoying clicking sound when you adjust its size. Compared to this I think the Jorgenson brand is better, I have two of that as well, a lot more smooth to operate.
customer_reviews.author: T Wang

customer_reviews.title: Stiff spring, difficult to slid jaw
customer_reviews.text: Have used these for a few projects now. Spring in locking mechanism is very stiff making them a little difficult to use. Maybe they will loosen a bit over time. But hold good and do the job for a good price.
customer_reviews.author: hey!

customer_reviews.title: These work great for small wood working projects
customer_reviews.text: These work great for small wood working projects. I purchased 2 to repair four dining room chairs that have fallen apart at the joints. They're surprisingly heavy duty for the price you pay and clamp tightly. So far the project is working out, I'm satisfied with these!
customer_reviews.author: CrispyFoo

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and Easy, But Not Super Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Was using this to hold some wood pieces together after sanding and gluing. The plastic swivel ends are pretty cheap though and really don't like to hold things very firmly. I ended up putting cloth around the ends with some tape and this fixed the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Clay

customer_reviews.title: Junk after a couple uses
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in these. After using a handful of times, one of the several I ordered failed. Now I feel like I have to replace the rest if the same thing will happen, or risk them ruining a job... uhggg.
customer_reviews.author: Public Name was required...

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value, great product!
customer_reviews.text: For the price I paid, these are amazing metal clamps. I use these to make various sized wooden boxes (jewelry, music, treasure, etc). The only problem I've had is the plastic red protector on the endpiece falling off. A touch of glue fixed that.
customer_reviews.author: Andy in Utah

customer_reviews.title: strong spring lock,
customer_reviews.text: Good strong metal shaft, strong spring lock, well made powder coated cast iron jaws, and the protective pads are made of hard rubber. does not damage your wood piece if you lock it with moderate force.
customer_reviews.author: rudy

customer_reviews.title: Decent quality not the best at. 24” clamp. ( cabinet maker )
customer_reviews.text: Decent for light work. I think there’s better 24” clamps out there ( I.E Irwin) This is definitely one of there cheapest clamps and quality made . Having said that all there upper typebox clamps are amazing .
customer_reviews.author: Nate_G

customer_reviews.title: Great for price however make sure all parts are with your clamp.
customer_reviews.text: Overall satified with the clamp. Works great ive made cutting boards and going away placques for people at work. One thing i was disappointed by was that one of the three that i ordered came without the rubber piece on the non swivel side. Basically making it useless unless i use a scrap piece of wood.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: but they are nice for the price
customer_reviews.text: These are diffinitely not to be confused with the heavy duty version, but they are nice for the price. I like the nickle coated steel rather than the black so it doesn't stain the wood. Overall, it's nice for the $ and from a brand you can trust.
customer_reviews.author: ZD

customer_reviews.title: Convenient tool to have
customer_reviews.text: Needed this to hold a sink up under the granite while the epoxy cured. It was easy to use, held its tension and looks like it can come in handy for other odd projects.
customer_reviews.author: Void

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money.
customer_reviews.text: The build quality is great for the price paid. I only wish that every time somebody builds another bar clamp they didn't feel they had to re-invent the wheel. The release button on this one is unique to this series, is a bit awkward and seems to be that way just to be different. The bottom line: I already have about a bezillion bar clamps but I've already had to use these several times. A wood-guy can never have too many clamps!
customer_reviews.author: riverguy

customer_reviews.title: Reasonably priced clamps
customer_reviews.text: These clamps are reasonably priced and do the trick for standard clamping needs. I have various sizes of the Bessey brand clamps, most of which are these 24 inch-ers. Not much else to say.
customer_reviews.author: Marco Esquandolas

customer_reviews.title: It's big.
customer_reviews.text: I was fixing a file cabinet and I needed somebody that would be able to hold the drawer together. This work perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Raposa

customer_reviews.title: 4.5 star clamp
customer_reviews.text: On the fence whether to give it 4 or 5 stars. Overall it's a 4 star clamp when compared to my US made Jorgensen's but for the price I paid on sale it's a 5 star clamp. At regular price, 4 stars. Sale price, 5 stars. It is much beefier than Harbor Freight clamps but feels a little slighter than my Jorgs.
customer_reviews.author: R.A.M.Top Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Good clamp bad shipping
customer_reviews.text: The clamp is as intended and works fine. Shipping was disappointing. The box was 10 times too big and since there was so much room for the clamps to move around one of them was sticking out about a foot.
customer_reviews.author: Franz

customer_reviews.title: Very high quality!
customer_reviews.text: When I ordered these clamps I didn't expect anything outstanding, but when I opened the box I found that they were very solid. I had read many reviews saying that they were disappointed because of the shallow threads and plastic handle. They actually have very thick threads and the handle is in fact made of wood (I don't really think it matters plastic would be just fine). Over all this is a great product and I wI'll probably get more! :)
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: and I am glad to have found it
customer_reviews.text: This clamp was difficult to find in the big-box hardware stores, and I am glad to have found it. It is just what I needed to mend my broken chair by holding the glued section in place.
customer_reviews.author: Bert R

customer_reviews.title: Bought several. Love them!
customer_reviews.text: Love these clamps! Not the most heavy duty clamps you can get, but they work amazing for my needs. I use them to clamp flags that I make together for final gluing/nailing.
customer_reviews.author: Ronnie D. Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Great for the DIY guy/gal
customer_reviews.text: This is a great clamp for my purposes. I wouldn't call it a professional tool but something for the DIY guy/gal. I got tired of gluing furniture back together without proper tools so I bought some clamps. The best part is the piece that I can add on to make it a three way clamp.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Pope

customer_reviews.title: Great clamps.  Get at least 2 of them.
customer_reviews.text: These are easy to use and plenty strong. My only complaint is that the rubber piece on the clamping face comes off easier than I think it should, so I've lost a few. Other than this issue, these are my favorite clamps.
customer_reviews.author: David Coleman

customer_reviews.title: Good quality.
customer_reviews.text: I’’be bought several different kinds of these and these are my favorites i’ve had to return other ones, while these have worked great. We made over 30 DIY kitchen cabinet doors with these.
customer_reviews.author: Stewart and Elizabeth Olney

customer_reviews.title: It works like you would expect a thing like this to work
customer_reviews.text: It works like you would expect a thing like this to work. I've had no issues with quality or usage since buying it. I originally bought it to clamp a chair that broke in a new dining set (was easier to just repair it then send out for a new part or return it). I've since used it to help fix a side table and a cabinet door in my kitchen. I'd recommend it as a general usage tool and it has a great price. It might not be suitable for professionals but your basic home DIY stuff it works great.
customer_reviews.author: SwayingBacon

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Be careful with these clamps i have three that the wood handle has fallen apart on.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler B

customer_reviews.title: Missing pads
customer_reviews.text: Nice clamps, but missing two rectangular plastic pads. Why should I return all four clamps because of two missing plastic pads?!
customer_reviews.author: Jim Grisaffi

customer_reviews.title: Love it just as much as my small one...great all around size for DIY!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a DIY'er and I love my little hand clamps...use them for everything. Every now and then I need a bigger clamp but since I'm not building houses or anything, I didn't want to spend a ton of money. I have this same clamp in the smaller size and love it so this one was a no-brainer. I've found that this is a good all around size and pretty much covers anything I need to clamp.
customer_reviews.author: go_lope

customer_reviews.title: Slight slippage
customer_reviews.text: Clamps on the end should be larger to avoid slippage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid for basic clamping purposes
customer_reviews.text: Mount bench grinder and vise to base boards. Then use these to clamp the base boards to work table surface. Lets me free up the whole table if I need to. These do a great job, easy to lock/engage and no slips. Tried to get creative during deck building and the "Economy" part of the title came into play. Stay with basic clamping and you'll be happy, just don't push it. They didn't break or anything, just couldn't hold what I needed in place.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Its a Bessey
customer_reviews.text: Quality, good teeth. Want more of the same. I have hand me down Besseys decades old going strong.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Get yourself a pair
customer_reviews.text: Can’t go wrong with these guys. They are a workhorse in my shop. Consistent quality and durability. These are going to be around for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Liane Musico

customer_reviews.title: great for what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: I have not used them yet but they seem fine for what I am looking for. Bill
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: really tough good budget clamps, function perfectly
customer_reviews.text: good clamps they are rugged and thick and seem well made, havent had any problems with them, great starter clamps for starting woodworking. way cheaper than at the hardware store
customer_reviews.author: LiliVale

customer_reviews.title: the wrong item.
customer_reviews.text: i was unable to use it ,it was to big.
customer_reviews.author: Clarence P.

customer_reviews.title: In this case "Economy" doesn't mean low quality!
customer_reviews.text: Bessey makes the best clamps! This are great. Exactly what I would expect from Bessey. Not sure why they're considered "economy" because most things label "economy" actually translate to "cheaply made" which is not the case with these clamps. I recommend them highly.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Bastoky

customer_reviews.title: used these clamps right away and I'm extremely satisfied with them
customer_reviews.text: Package arrived a day earlier than expected, used these clamps right away and I'm extremely satisfied with them, 12 bucks a piece and worth every penny, I would highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: BambamAmazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What I would expect from Bessey
customer_reviews.text: Used these before for medium duty and they are great. There was a real deal on these, so I got 4. They came a day early and were individually wrapped in bubble wrap in an undamaged carton.
customer_reviews.author: hockydo

customer_reviews.title: More Clamps!
customer_reviews.text: They clamp my woodworking projects together well. I like these more than the pump style clamps just due to the simpler design. Sure, it's not quite as fast as the irwin style quick clamps, but i think they hold better and will last longer. And c'mon, you're not gluing things together while woodworking because you like everything to be "speedy"....
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Okay for the price ,i wish it was a little more heavy duty.
customer_reviews.text: wish it was built little stronger but overall for the price it is okay& handy.
customer_reviews.author: Fruit L.

customer_reviews.title: LIGHTduty clamps
customer_reviews.text: I'm used to much better quality coming from Bessey. These are real light duty clamps and I do not recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: 211steve

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Great clamps at a great price. I used them for a 2x4 project that I was working on, They were easy to use and help my pieces together very well. I wouldn't hesitate to buy these again or more if I needed them.
customer_reviews.author: VelocityTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: 25% failure rate
customer_reviews.text: Bought 4 of these. Have used them less than a dozen times and one is already stripped. Can't put any pressure on it. Have only been used for basic cabinet building.
customer_reviews.author: David Worsham

customer_reviews.title: Great value for a basic clamp
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice and practical clamp to perform basic tasks where the needs to be delicate aren't the foremost concern. Light weight and simple mechanics to operate. All metal construction except the handle and contacts for the clamp. Great price and value.
customer_reviews.author: Justin M.

customer_reviews.title: Quality designed product.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice quality product. Easy to tighten, and very easy to release the tension. I used them to "hold" an old plaster of paris painting that had fallen and broken into 3 pieces. No problem in tightening these just enough for a tight fit without having to over tighten as with a ratchet system with the possibility of creating additional breakage.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Works well, can get really tight. Does not flex or loosen easily.
customer_reviews.text: probably only 4.5 stars but at the bargain price it is 5. Works well, can get really tight. Does not flex or loosen easily. Worked on everything I tried.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Seda

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Product, Great Price & Many Uses!
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic and at a great price. I recently used for my kitchen remodel and these were great for glue and clamping overnight. Used it on drawer boxes and dammaged door fronts, both overnight jobs held great!!
customer_reviews.author: NJ Joe

customer_reviews.title: Standard Bessey Clamps
customer_reviews.text: These clamps are the best value for the money. I recommend them anytime they're up on sale or listed for a good price. Pretty much standard for any home woodworker.
customer_reviews.author: henlouis

customer_reviews.title: and these look like plastic compared to those
customer_reviews.text: it still works, but i bought one at home depot for a little cheaper, and these look like plastic compared to those.(they r still iron or something, not plastic) but i gess it doesnt matter wat they look like, as long as they work
customer_reviews.author: mare

customer_reviews.title: Failed after one month of light use
customer_reviews.text: The clamp is reasonably flexible but it failed on me a month after I bought it as it won’t grip on the teeth. I was using it on weekends to do a small building project which did not entail heavy duty use. I would avoid this product as it should last longer than this.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Eckhold

customer_reviews.title: Extremely good value
customer_reviews.text: Works and holds perfectly, the few times I've used these so far. Exactly what I was expecting, they're very beefy, heavy, and haven't slipped on me yet
customer_reviews.author: Sprink1es

customer_reviews.title: If you need big clamps, buy these. Buy several.
customer_reviews.text: I recently got involved in wood working and these are the best purchase I have made. They are significantly lower priced than similar clamps and have held up very well with regular use. Feels solid, easy to use, and holds very well. I've used them so much already that I can't believe I ever did projects without any. If you need big clamps on a little budget, you cannot go wrong with these. I think I'll buy 3 or 4 more to keep on hand in the shop.
customer_reviews.author: AvidConsumer

customer_reviews.title: Good basic clamps from a quality manufacturer
customer_reviews.text: I like this type of clamp, and Bessey's are good quality. It seems like you can never have too many clamps, and I was glad to add these to my collection.
customer_reviews.author: GraniteDon

customer_reviews.title: I like the diversity given by how long it is as ...
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I needed. I like the diversity given by how long it is as well. It's easy to manipulate and has a sturdy grip.
customer_reviews.author: Joy Nicole Skipper

customer_reviews.title: Well made clamps
customer_reviews.text: Very well made. Solid materials. Nice, soft caps. Straight bars on all four that I ordered. Sit flat on my bench. Open just a little wider than 24" so that you can actually clamp 24" projects, as opposed to not opening far enough like some "24 inch" clamps.
customer_reviews.author: Owen O.

customer_reviews.title: Nice clamp for the money
customer_reviews.text: This clamp seems to be of surprisingly high quality for the low price. It's very handy and I am glad I have it.
customer_reviews.author: Ombudsman

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: They work good on something that doesn't require a lot of clamping power but slip easily when over clamped.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good clamps. They seem to be good construction and apply plenty of pressure.
customer_reviews.author: devin

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: perfect for the frames we were trying to hold in place while we glued and nailed them.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: I use it here and there. Does what I need so far
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Great Clamps
customer_reviews.text: these are great clamps I use them all the time . They only have one problem the rubber feet like to fall off, so I just glued them on and problem fixed. I have used these for everything and I'm sure will keep using them forever
customer_reviews.author: Scout

customer_reviews.title: Missing item from purchase
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 2x 24" clamps and I received 1x 24" clamp.
customer_reviews.author: Porter

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic clamps.
customer_reviews.text: Holds my wood working projects together just fine. Really like the clamping mechanism as it allows me to adjust tightness without over tightening.
customer_reviews.author: S. Gyulie

customer_reviews.title: Good for what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Lighter than I expected but get the job done. Bought because I like Bessey pipe clamps.
customer_reviews.author: LogicOnly

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These work really well! I have total of 3 and I use them on almost all of my projects!
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: Works good. It is not as handy as the squeeze clamps, but it works great. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Dave Hunziger

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the money. Strong enough to do some basic projects... If you need need superior strength, I would go with something different, but it will cost you a lot more.
customer_reviews.author: MS94

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Used it to clamp my wireless vacuum that needed fixing on the ends. Issue fixed. I am sure I will use it for many other projects. Sturdy and worth the price. Would buy again if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Rene V.

customer_reviews.title: clamps
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as a gift and after reading so many reviews on different clamps, I took a chance on this one and a 36" one. They were well received. They were used on a kitchen cabinet remodel and they worked just fine. For the value, I would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Bet and Net

customer_reviews.title: Super annoying and I will be returning the broken one
customer_reviews.text: Ordered two as I was trying to make a cutting board, and right after I glued the slats together I was tightening one of these down and it just popped and then refused to catch. Super annoying and I will be returning the broken one.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: They seem to be holding up beautifully in my shop
customer_reviews.text: Quality clamps! They seem to be holding up beautifully in my shop.
customer_reviews.author: William Matschukat

customer_reviews.title: Quality clamps at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: I love these clamps. Super strong and reliable, and the price was right.
customer_reviews.author: Chris C.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Wish the jaws had a bit more reach. I did not know they were so shallow.
customer_reviews.author: BNye.

customer_reviews.title: Great price for every day light duty clamping
customer_reviews.text: Great price for these clamps. Very good for light work. They will bow a little if you need a real tight clamp on heavier material.
customer_reviews.author: BDK

customer_reviews.title: Great clamp - especially for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great clamp - especially for the price. I built a work bench using these without any problems. The clamps had no bend to them at all when under pressure.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph R Earley

customer_reviews.title: Great low end clamp
customer_reviews.text: I have started to do some house hold wood work and chose this clamp because of the easy adjustment and solid build. Super easy to use and the rubber clamps don't let go.
customer_reviews.author: C. Costales

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THEM!!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THESE!! I am very new to any type of woodworking so I am slowly figuring out what makes the job easier. These are wonderful!!
customer_reviews.author: Dog Mom

customer_reviews.title: It’s a bessey.
customer_reviews.text: They’ve never let me down with anything I’ve bought of theirs.
customer_reviews.author: BJ

customer_reviews.title: Very good product - Bought 4 of these and the quality ...
customer_reviews.text: Very good product - Bought 4 of these and the quality and shipping was fast and 3 days later bought 4 more.
customer_reviews.author: Jacque

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: For an economy version, these clamps are very good. Holding strength is at least what they claim.
customer_reviews.author: Honking Goose

customer_reviews.title: Great value for light-to moderate duty clamp.
customer_reviews.text: Moderate duty clamp at a great price. Over-clamping will most likely snap off the handle.
customer_reviews.author: William J. Konietzny

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great addition to my shop. About as good as any other clamp.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Grips like a champ
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected I would purchase this item again. I wish I would have purchased this sooner it would have saved me many headaches in my projects.
customer_reviews.author: The Realdeal

customer_reviews.title: Well-enough made, did the trick
customer_reviews.text: Needed to glue some laminate that was coming off a cupboard, was able to insert the glue and clamp a piece of wood against the laminate and across the entire width of the cupboard until the glue set. Worked beautifully.
customer_reviews.author: James A. Cahill

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality metal, doesn't bend
customer_reviews.text: refurbishing restaurant chairs and this product is absolutely perfect! It stays tight and keeps my chairs very firm while the glue dries. combine this with a ratchet tiedown cable and you have some solid good-as-new chairs!
customer_reviews.author: slevin

customer_reviews.title: Okay for light work.
customer_reviews.text: If you need a third hand this clamp will work. If you need to open it up and crank it down for glue ups, you'll start to see it bow. If you keep it around 18" you'll see less flex.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Divello

customer_reviews.title: Works as Expected
customer_reviews.text: Using this primarily for brake jobs and it worked as expected.
customer_reviews.author: AmeriCentric

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price
customer_reviews.text: Not bad for the price. Relatively sturdy but the tiny hand screw makes it hard to get good leverage to make it super tight. The metal shaft bows under normal hand cranked pressure.
customer_reviews.author: Ben B. Photography

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Clamps are not great quality but are ok for the money
customer_reviews.author: Ken R

customer_reviews.title: Great clamps, great price
customer_reviews.text: These work great for all my home projects. Very good price when compared to hardware stores. I'm very satisfied with this product.
customer_reviews.author: robkc

customer_reviews.title: Good for small jobs
customer_reviews.text: Not bad for small jobs. I tightened it a bit too much and I noticed it began to curve and bend.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Capone

customer_reviews.title: Nice sturdy, reliable vlamp
customer_reviews.text: Nice sturdy clamp, will be perfect for my wood working projects. Thanks for the great service, and the great price.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great light duty clamps.
customer_reviews.text: Good clamps that perform adequately for light or some medium jobs. However, if you try to use them for a job that requires heavy clamping, the bar will bend and they will not be nearly as tight as other better albeit more expensive clamps.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Houtman

customer_reviews.title: Can't apply pressure
customer_reviews.text: The clamp doesn't work. When you twist to apply pressure it loosens a notch on the ridges along the main rail. One by one it widens as you continue to twist. It's possible this one is defective but the ridges don't seem deep enough to hold much pressure at all
customer_reviews.author: jtb

product_meta.title: Bessey GSCC2.524 2.5-Inch x 24-Inch Economy Clutch Style Bar Clamp
feature_bullets: Suitable for a wide range of woodworking & DIY projects
Durable powder coated cast iron fixed & sliding jaws
Protective pads for both top and bottom jaws
Protective pads for both top and bottom jaws
